_exec_summary.SummaryText:
FACILITY INFORMATION CONTACT
Atkinson Fertilizer, Inc.
   Rossman Facility
P.O. Box 9
302 North Main Street
Atkinson, NE. 68713
(402) 925-2221

1.FACILITY POLICY:The owner,management,and employees of Atkinson Fertilizer, Inc -  Rossman Facility, are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is  prepared to work with the local fire department, or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.

2.FACILITY INFORMATION: The facility is located near Stuart, NE. The primary activity at the location is the storage of fertilizers for sale to farmers. Anhydrous ammonia is received and stored while awaiting delivery to the farmer.

3.WORST-CASE RELEASE SCENARIO  and ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO: 
 An analyis of the off-site consequences of a hypothetical worst-case release scenario and alternative release scenario have been addressed in our Hazard Assessment and information is in our Risk Management Program.

4.ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM: The facility has implemented the Standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia" and our state regulations covering anhydrous ammonia. 

5.FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY: There have been no accidental realeases ot anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.

6.EMERGENCY ACTION PROGRAM: Emergency Action Plan:

a.  A written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.38;

b.  Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and Community right to know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);

c.  If a large release of anhydrou

s ammonia takes place at the facility, the required response action is to evacuate the area of the spill and call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers listed in our Emergency Action Plan.

7.PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY: Safety improvement is an on-going process at our facility. Periodic evaluations are preformed to assess our prevention and safety programs. There are no additional specific safety recommendations at this time.
